Daren Darnell

Student.  Developer.

View My Timeline

expand_more

  • May 2020: CS50

    With my newfound free time during the pandemic, I decided to take up programming. I enrolled in Harvard's online Intro to Computer Science course and wrote my first line of code in May of 2020. The course took us through the basics of programming in C and is where I found my love for coding.

  • August 2021: College & Python

    I started my first year of college at George Mason University as a computer science major. I began learning python in Mason's CS112 class.

  • October 2021: HTML, CSS, & Sass

    While studying at George Mason I began to think of ideas for programs but didn't have enough development skills to start these projects. So, I decided to learn HTML & CSS. I enrolled in Brad Traversy's Modern HTML & CSS From The Beginning. I finished the course in November gaining valuable skills to use in later projects.

  • November 2021: Javascript
